seo.title: Import Audio to AI: Turn Voice Memos into Meeting Minutes (New Feature)
seo.description: Recorded a meeting on Voice Memos? Now you can import audio files (m4a, mp3, wav, mp4) directly into Minutes.AI to generate full transcripts and summaries.
seo.ogTitle: Import Audio Files to Minutes.AI — M4A, MP3, WAV Supported
seo.ogDescription: Finally, a way to turn those giant audio files into actionable minutes. Supports up to 200MB and diverse formats like m4a, mp3, and flac.

ld.headline: How to Create Meeting Minutes from Existing Audio Files
ld.description: A guide on using the new Import Audio feature in Minutes.AI. Solves the problem of restricted device usage during meetings by processing pre-recorded audio.

hero.h1: Recorded Elsewhere? No Problem. Turn Audio Files into AI Minutes.
hero.tagline: Whether it's a Voice Memo, a Zoom recording, or a file from a dedicated recorder—you can now import them directly into Minutes.AI for instant transcription and summarization.

problem.p1: We've all been there. You're in a high-security meeting where 'cloud apps' are banned, but offline recording is allowed. Or maybe you simply forgot to open the AI app and hit record on Apple Voice Memos instead.
problem.p2: Until now, you were stuck with a 60-minute audio file and a blank page. Listening to the whole thing again just to type notes is painful. **That ends today.**

solution.intro: We have updated the iOS app to support **'External Audio Import'**. You can now bring files from other apps, your iCloud Drive, or your device storage directly into our processing engine.

features.d: Got a long meeting? No sweat. We currently support files up to 200MB, covering most standard lengthy sessions. (And we plan to expand this soon!)
You don't just get a summary. You get the raw, time-stamped text of who said what, plus the structured minutes you know and love.
M4A, MP3, WAV, MP4... we handle the conversion so you don't have to.

formats.intro: We've built our engine to recognize the most common audio and video containers used in business today:

items.title: The 'Strict Security' Meeting
items.desc: Some companies block internet access in boardrooms but allow offline dictaphones. Record there, then import the file later when you're back online.

items.title: The 'Oops, I Forgot' Moment
items.desc: Used the default recorder out of habit? Don't panic. Share the file from Voice Memos to Minutes.AI and save your evening.

items.title: The Legacy Archive
items.desc: Have a folder of old interviews or lectures on your drive? Import them to finally make them searchable and summarized.
